Name: A Fleeting Night's Dream
QuestDesc:
A mysterious letter gently lifts a corner of the veil that shrouds the nights gone by.
A faint whisper from the depths of the abyss waits for your reply.

Unlock.Name: Help Cherry hand out the tonic

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The message feels cryptic, and the bizarre formatting gives you an uneasy feeling.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Night of Remembrance? Is that another special event in Egla Town?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (And this message… Is it a prank? Or is there more to this?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The longer you stare at the message, the more the words seem to twist and distort, heightening your unease.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, what's this smell?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nope, I can't take it… Gotta take a break…

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ew, why do I still smell it down here? Wait, this weird frequency… It's coming from that message!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, my head… so dizzy… I'm gonna lie down. Just... just holler if you need me…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like we've been hit by the weird frequency in that message. I should check out what's going on in Egla Town.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You receive a strange message from a "ghost girl." The twisted frequency within it affects both you and Abby.

To uncover the mystery and lift its effects, you decide to attend the Night of Remembrance in Egla Town, as mentioned in the message.

Chapters.Title: Find the Night of Remembrance guide

Dialogues.Speaker: Night of Remembrance Guide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bells chime, spirits awake. Mask up for the ghost parade! Welcome, dear guest. Are you here for the Night of Remembrance?

Options.PlotLineKey: What is the Night of Remembrance?
Yes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Night of Remembrance Guide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the only night in a year when the lost souls return to the mortal realm! Wear your mask and blend into this special gathering. You never know who or "what" might be hiding behind the mask…

Dialogues.Speaker: Night of Remembrance Guide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, well, that's a plain reaction. Can't scare you, huh? Alright, let me explain it properly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Night of Remembrance Guide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Night of Remembrance is an annual festival in Egla Town, dedicated to honoring those who have passed. When night falls, people dress up like ghosts and join in a variety of activities.

Dialogues.Speaker: Night of Remembrance Guide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And… Er… Oh dear, can't quite remember the rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Night of Remembrance Guide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem! Anyway, to satisfy your curiosity, why not see for yourself? All you need is a mask.

Dialogues.Speaker: Night of Remembrance Guide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fabulous! All you need is a mask.

Options.PlotLineKey: (Take out the mask.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like this one?

Dialogues.Speaker: Night of Remembrance Guide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is… the mask of the Laureate! What an honor to meet the new Laureate in person! Yes, this one will do perfectly!

Dialogues.Speaker: Night of Remembrance Guide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Laureate enjoys the same privileges as the host of this festival, so please, enjoy yourself tonight!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The guide briefs you on what the Night of Remembrance is. It's an annual festival in Egla Town, dedicated to honoring those who have passed. People dress up like ghosts at night for various activities.

The guide tells you to wear a mask for the event, and you show him the mask of the Laureate, which works perfectly.

Chapters.Title: Talk to the guide and re-enter the Night of Remembrance festival

Dialogues.Speaker: Night of Remembrance Guide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Would you like to proceed, honored Laureate?

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes, please.
I need a moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Night of Remembrance Guide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perfect! Please, follow me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Night of Remembrance Guide
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course. Please take your time. I'm here to assist whenever you need me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Cantarella? What's she doing here?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the bustling event, you spot Cantarella in the crowd. She smiles at you from a distance and signals you to follow her.

Chapters.Title: Head to the central square where the Night of Remembrance is held

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What a pleasure to meet you again, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, what brings a distinguished Laureate to this ghostly place?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tired of heavenly views, are we? Hehe, are you here to savor the underworld's wonders and dance with its spirits?

Options.PlotLineKey: What brings the head of Fisalia here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why not? What harm could there be in a ghost of the deep reveling among spirits?

Options.PlotLineKey: So you're also a ghost of the deep.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Also?" What are you implying?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You show the strange message to Cantarella.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: On the Night of Remembrance, it's only natural that the departed return to the mortal realm for their unfulfilled wishes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still, it'd be best if they didn't stir up trouble for the living.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In my humble opinion, lost souls find peace only when their wishes are fulfilled. Then, perhaps, they'll stop haunting people.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since fate has brought you here, why not offer your aid to those poor, restless souls? I'll join you, of course.

Options.PlotLineKey: I don't usually do ghost work.
Why would you offer to help me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, the familiar confusion of a first-timer. But fret not, for I will be your guide through this unforgettable night. Step by step.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shhh, no need to jump to conclusions. Who knows, it might actually be you doing me a favor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Every Night of Remembrance brings its own theme. And this year, it's the "Ghost Girl."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Imagine this: an innocent girl lost in the dark sea, fear ripping her apart as her soul drifts away, while her body sinks ever deeper into the abyss. Despair consumes her, bit by bit, until she transforms into a monstrous phantom.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A thrilling story, don't you agree? Like savoring a medium-rare lamb chop served with oysters. One tender slice, and the crimson juice spills, adding just the right flavor to the already exquisite dish.

Options.PlotLineKey: I like exquisite things, too.
Not sure I love it.
You're making my skin crawl.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh… So we share similar tastes. How wonderful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, really? Then consider it a simple "appetizer" for tonight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, is it too much for an innocent lamb like yourself? Hehe, my apologies. I hope this doesn't dampen your spirits.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After reading the strange message you received, Cantarella explains that the Night of Remembrance is centered around ghost-related themes. Tonight's theme happens to be the "ghost girl."

She senses the effect on you and invites you to join the event, promising that you'll recover once you solve the riddles prepared for tonight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, back to our topic. Hidden among the stalls set up for tonight are three riddles entwined with the tale of the "ghost girl." Yet, these stalls are rather elusive. Rumor has it that they might even be run… by demons.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But of course, there are no demons in this world, only distorted frequencies or men cloaked in disguise, driven by their unmet desires.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Dealing with them requires no money. Instead, they sift through your desires, choosing what to claim for themselves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Isn't that enchanting? There's no thrill in simply buying all your heart's desires with mere money.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And now, we have the "main course" for tonight: whoever solves all three riddles and uncovers the mystery of the "ghost girl" can ask the host for an elixir.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whether to turn stones into gold, grant eternal youth, or even bring the dead back to life… Whichever you want, this potion is here to make it real.

Options.PlotLineKey: I want the one that turns stones into gold.
I want the one that brings the dead back to life.
I just want to get rid of whatever effect that message had on me.
I doubt it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well then, might I suggest we collaborate to secure this reward?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am after a particular elixir myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well then, might I suggest we collaborate to secure this reward?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am after a particular elixir myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Such admirable restraint. However, it's too late to withdraw from this game, as the ghosts have already begun to shadow your every step.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: According to that message, bringing those ghosts back to the mortal realm might clear the effects weighing on you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, might I suggest we collaborate to win the elixir that brings the dead back to life? I could also use that elixir myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In that case, why not unravel the lies and find the truth yourself? It could be quite enjoyable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come and join me in this game. I know you won't let go of any potential clues.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, there are certain places that only you may be able to reach.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I happen to need a special elixir myself.

Options.PlotLineKey: I thought someone as talented as you could make any potion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, it requires more than you might imagine: the finest ingredients, precise procedures, impeccable techniques, and, of course, the proper mood.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But with you at my side, even the most intricate elixir would be a delight to create.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd love to explore this with you, be it elixir or poison.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Cantarella tells you that three riddles entwined with the tale of the "ghost girl" are hidden among the stalls set up for tonight.

Whoever solves all three riddles and uncovers the mystery of the "ghost girl" can ask the host for an elixir that grants any wish. You're skeptical, but Cantarella seems intrigued. You decide to join her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Offer your soul, surrender your flesh. Give all you have, call the lost from their rest...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That sounds uncanny.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, sorry. Forgive me if it unsettles you. It's an old folk song about the Night of Remembrance. They say its eerie melody has a strange frequency that can draw the attention of ravenous "demons."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah… I can feel it now. There it is—the first stall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cantarella steps forward with unwavering certainty, her movement ethereal, drifting like a ghost. At this moment, she seems capable of summoning demons herself. Without hesitation, you follow her lead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mammon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Welcome. Would you like to reach for the brightest star in the sky, or indulge in the greatest joy of the mortal world?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mammon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or maybe… nothing could ever satisfy your endless desire?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Always so playful, Mammon. Unfortunately, my friend here isn't driven by greed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All we seek is the first riddle of the "ghost girl" to set the tone for tonight. After all, even the smallest catch can serve as a splendid entrée for a grand feast.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mammon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see, but nothing comes for free. If you want it, you'll have to trade me something entertaining.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mammon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps a loaf of bread that speaks, oil that melts into water, or... a glimpse into Fisalia's hidden past.

Options.PlotLineKey: How about a special performance from a Laureate?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mammon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, just for me? That would be an honor I'd truly relish.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Mammon, the owner of the first stall, says he will only give you the first riddle if you exchange something precious.

As the new Laureate, you offer a performance, which he gladly accepts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mammon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How marvelous! I hear the sounds of birth and doom, of everlasting mountains and seas, and the fierce pulses of life!

Dialogues.Speaker: Mammon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is life's symphony, each note threaded by the loom of time, more alluring than any Siren's call!

Dialogues.Speaker: Mammon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As promised, here is the first riddle: The Siren's Song.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mammon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Long ago, a group of girls followed the Siren's call out of town. They journeyed to the 'crown' atop the mountain and to the waterfall that cascaded into the depths."

Dialogues.Speaker: Mammon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Beyond this riddle, I, Mammon, have yet another gift to offer for your performance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mammon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please take this music box. It's dusty with age, but it might just sing again with a song like you just played.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Impressed by your performance, Mammon reveals to you the first riddle: The Siren's Song.

"Long ago, a group of girls followed the Siren's call out of town. They journeyed to the 'crown' atop the mountain and to the waterfall that cascaded into the depths below."

He also offers you a music box.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That person does seem a bit extra...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's understandable. Hearing a Laureate perform is an honor, a blessing for everyone in Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even this music box should be humming along in admiration…

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cantarella taps the music box, but it doesn't work as expected.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, so that's why this little thing isn't behaving… Someone must have silenced it, leaving it unable to sing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cantarella's fingers move deftly as she tinkers with the music box, but it remains silent.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As Cantarella examines it, you notice the music box has a unique shape.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you look at this music box from above, doesn't it resemble a big apple?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, now that you mention it… Indeed, it does.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps Mammon has offered us a little aperitif.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, I know where we need to go next… The second riddle is waiting for us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
As Cantarella tinkers with the music box, you notice its shape resembles an apple.

Inspired by your observation, she solves the first riddle and leads you to the second stall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beelzbul
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know what you came for.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beelzbul
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Without exceptional insight and unparalleled courage, all you'll end up with are mere scraps.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beelzbul
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you lack what I seek, then just swallow the scraps with the ashes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good enough for the fishes, perhaps, but hardly something to serve at the table.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This distinguished friend of mine deserves nothing less than the finest dish and the freshest apple.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beelzbul
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well then, give it a try. May you find the freshest apple.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beelzbul
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go on, make a choice. Let's see if this apple holds the prize you seek.

Options.PlotLineKey: (Choose one)
(Look for help from Cantarella)

Dialogues.Speaker: Beelzbul
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh… What made you choose this one? Was it your sharp intuition, or the ability to see right through everything?

Dialogues.Speaker: Beelzbul
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No need to answer. There's something in you. I can tell your soul is burning like a flame that no ash could ever smother.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beelzbul
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take this "luck" hidden within the freshest apple. You deserve it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Cantarella gives you a reassuring glance.
Her eyes shimmer like ripples over a moonlit sea as she gazes at the apple and gestures gracefully.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That one, please.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beelzbul
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, the rumors are true—nothing escapes your keen gaze, Cantarella the Bane.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beelzbul
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This little taste of "luck" is just a starter. Now, allow me to serve the main dish.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beelzbul
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here comes the second riddle: The Red Apple.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beelzbul
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "The girls lined up for their apples, each one in a vivid, glistening red… but why would apples appear in the deep sea?"

Dialogues.Speaker: Beelzbul
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whether it brings "luck" or "misfortune," taste it and see for yourselves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The owner of the second stall is Beelzebul, who asks you to pick the freshest apple in the stall. After you find the correct apple, Beelzebul gives you a "lucky coin" and reveals the second riddle: The Red Apple.

"The girls lined up for their apples, each one in a vivid, glistening red… but why would apples appear in the deep sea?"

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: People of Rinascita often use coin tosses for divination.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heads up signifies good fortune, a sign of following the sacred path. Tails up, however, invites misfortune, a mark of defiance against the Divinity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The front of the coin features a doll in a red hat, while the back shows one in blue. The coin has an unusual appearance, with uneven, ribbed edges.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are these dolls blessed or cursed?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps the last riddle will give us a clue.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The coin isn't perfectly round, with its edges ribbed and uneven. The front of the coin features a doll in a red hat, while the back shows one in blue.

Cantarella picks up on the clue and leads you to the third stall... But, isn't collecting these riddles going a bit too smoothly?

Dialogues.Speaker: Invidia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, which is the most beautiful among these dolls?

Dialogues.Speaker: Invidia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This one has bright eyes, that one has a nice nose, and that one there has red lips… Wait, this one's gotta be a bit less pretty. Can't let it outshine me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Invidia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, so frustrating. They're all gorgeous, but none quite live up to my standards!

Dialogues.Speaker: Invidia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now tell me, what do you think? Which doll stands out the most?

Options.PlotLineKey: (Pick the doll in a red hat)
(Pick the doll in a blue hat)
(Look for help from Cantarella)
They all look the same to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Invidia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The lucky red hat! Exactly! Following the divine will is always a wise choice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Invidia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Defying the divine will is a reckless gamble with your very life at stake—one I wouldn't advise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Without waiting for your response, Invidia hands you a doll with a red hat.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cantarella's gaze seems to reflect a stormy sea, veiled in layers of mist that hide her feelings. After a moment, she picks up a doll with a red hat.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we obey the divine will, does that really bring us luck?

Dialogues.Speaker: Invidia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, I like your honesty! Yes, they're all pretty much the same, aren't they?

Dialogues.Speaker: Invidia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here, take this one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Invidia tosses the red-hat doll your way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you hold the doll, its features suddenly sharpen and become lifelike. Its delicate brows, bright eyes, and elegant attire seem to come to life in the blink of an eye.

Dialogues.Speaker: Invidia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wonderful! As long as you follow the Divinity, luck will surely be on your side!

Dialogues.Speaker: Invidia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, for dessert, I present you with fortune cookies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Invidia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the last riddle: The Round Hat.

Dialogues.Speaker: Invidia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "A girl dons her red dancing shoes and wears a scarlet hat, ready for the final act of her performance."

Dialogues.Speaker: Invidia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, all the riddles are in your hands! Whether the answers will rise like bubbles from the witch's cauldron, well, that's up to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Dolls wearing red and blue hats are placed in the third stall. The owner, Invidia, asks you to pick the most beautiful one. But no matter which one you choose, she insists on giving you the doll in the red hat, claiming that the red hat symbolizes divine will and brings luck.

She then tells you the last riddle: The Round Hat.

"A girl dons her red dancing shoes and wears a scarlet hat, ready for the final act of her performance."

Chapters.Title: Head to the resting area and discuss the clues with Cantarella

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now all the riddles are here, like fish returned to the sea. However, they are entangled in a maze of seaweed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How would you free them from the maze?

Options.PlotLineKey: Analyze the keywords of each riddle.
Find the connection between these items.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Siren's Song, the Red Apple, the Red Shoes and the Round Hat…

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Among the tales of Rinascita, all these three end bitterly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, with the Laureate's aid, we may see a different ending tonight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since all stories are rooted in reality, perhaps we should take a closer look at the three items we've collected.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's see... A dusty broken music box, a cog-like "lucky coin," and a doll in a red hat.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's see... A dusty broken music box, a cog-like "lucky coin," and a doll in a red hat.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're all out of production now. None of the music boxes these days use this kind of cog.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like these little trinkets are relics from the past.

Options.PlotLineKey: They can be assembled into a ballerina music box!
How about we put them together?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good catch. As a girl, I used to while away those endless, quiet hours in the castle by playing with such things.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps some part of me still remembers what to do… No, I'm certain I still do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cantarella places the doll on the music box's pedestal and slides the cog-like coin into the slot. Click—the missing cog clicks back into place. Just like that, the fish breaks free from the maze of seaweed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems all we need is the Laureate's performance to breathe life back into this old relic.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You realize that the music box, the cog-like "lucky coin," and the doll in a red hat can be assembled into a ballerina music box.

Cantarella puts the parts together and you perform once again. This time, the music box plays.
The show begins.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The melody evokes a sense of familiarity, reminding you of that place—<ano=Castle of Fisalia>Porto-Veno Castle</ano>。

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It only strengthens your suspicion that the "ghost girl" must be connected to the Fisalia castle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A sharp headache interrupts your thoughts, the distorted frequencies intensifying. Through the pain, you find a reason to visit the Fisalia castle.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh… what was that…? My head… This pain's getting worse. I need a break somewhere…

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've been under this influence far too long, especially in a place filled with spirits. I should have warned you sooner.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You need a proper rest… and we're not far from Thessaleo Fells.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come to my castle. I have potions there that can help ease the strain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
As the music box plays, the red hat doll materializes and dances, only to abruptly stop. You realize it was all an illusion, but the music reminds you of Porto-Veno Castle. A fleeting shadow crosses Cantarella's usually calm face.

A sharp headache interrupts your thoughts, the distorted frequencies intensifying. You seize the moment and ask Cantarella if you can rest at her castle, and she agrees.

Chapters.Title: Spend a night to remember with Cantarella

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hope this can help you feel better.

Options.PlotLineKey: Thank you. What's this?
Smells good. What's this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This potion is crafted from freshly crushed Barnacle Leaves, mixed with the sap of Violaca, Sea Okra, and Sea Apple, all fermented in a glass vial.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Each of these lovely plants is cultivated here, hand-picked, sorted, and blended by my own hands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As the poisonous ingredients entwine, their toxins soften over time, like nightmares transforming into the sweetest dreams.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, it's perfectly safe and even delightful. Drink up, and rest a while.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though I may not be able to lift the "curse" binding you just yet, I can certainly help tame it for now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah... Excuse me for a moment. It's time I tend to the flowers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The potion eases your headache, bringing clarity to your mind.
With renewed focus, you try to explore the castle for more clues.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Cantarella lets you rest in her garden and brings you a potion to ease your nerves. You feel much better after drinking it.

Cantarella then leaves to attend to other business, giving you a chance to search around.

Chapters.Title: Talk to the girl hiding in the flower bushes

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You find a young girl hiding behind a plant, peering at you with wide, timid eyes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her round red hat draws your attention, a striking resemblance to the one worn by the dancing doll in the music box.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sensing that her presence here is no coincidence, you brace yourself to ask her some bold questions.

Options.PlotLineKey: Excuse me. Who are you?
What are you doing here?
Are you one of the "ghost girls"?
Do you know where Cantarella is?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The girl attempts to speak, but all that escapes is unintelligible mumbling.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The girl nods decisively before running off to another area.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You spot a girl wearing a red round hat among the bushes. She tries to say something but can't speak, instead gesturing for you to follow her.

Chapters.Title: Follow the girl and inspect the apple-like plant

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you playing hide-and-seek with me?
Are you trying to show me this plant?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The girl shakes her head and then points at a crimson plant nearby. Its shape resembles an apple, yet it seems more like a peculiar marine creature.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The girl nods. The crimson plant resembles an apple, yet it seems more like a peculiar marine creature.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Apple... apple in the sea... Sea Apple!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Sea Apples are known to be poisonous. This clue must be key to solving the riddle of the Red Apple.
Before you can ask the girl anything more, she has already run to another spot.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The girl points at a crimson plant nearby. Its shape resembles an apple, yet it seems more like a peculiar marine creature.

You realize it's a poisonous Sea Apple, which may be the key to solving the riddle of the Red Apple.

Before you can question the girl, she runs to another part of the garden.

Chapters.Title: Follow the girl and inspect the jellyfish-like plant

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The girl nods. The plant resembles an apple, yet it seems more like a peculiar marine creature.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jellyrose... Round hat...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could the round hat worn by the girl in the riddle actually be a poisonous Jellyrose Medusa?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If that's true, then the "ghost girls" indeed have a connection to the Fisalias.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need to discuss this with Cantarella.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The girl nods decisively before running off to another area.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The girl points to a jellyfish-like plant, its crimson bloom resembling her own round hat.

Could the round hat from the riddle be a poisonous Jellyrose Medusa? If so, the "ghost girls" are tied to the Fisalias. You need to speak with Cantarella about this.

The girl seems to understand and runs off, gesturing for you to follow.

Chapters.Title: Find Cantarella and discuss what you learned

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You find Cantarella finishing a dance under the moonlight. Her graceful movements seem meant to regulate certain frequencies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, you've made it here. I'm glad to see you're feeling better. Now we can finally have a proper conversation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you come all this way for me, or are you in search of the secrets slumbering in the deep?

Options.PlotLineKey: I come for you.
I come for the secrets.
Both.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, I'm flattered… Don't worry, with someone as precious as you here in my castle, I'm not going anywhere.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, clever little fish… Have you figured it out? The answer has been right here, waiting to be discovered.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, such greed… Rest assured, I'm here to unravel the secrets with you, as I promised.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What exactly are the Sea Apples and the Jellyroses in the garden used for?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The crimson Sea Apple, also called "the alluring reaper," is a dangerous plant. A single bite can lead to paralysis, suffocation, or the excruciating pain of a burnt throat and torn organs—ultimately bringing its victim an agonizing death.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for the Jellyroses, their blooms will transform into Jellyrose Medusae. These little ones can produce a neurotoxin that induces intense hallucinations, and in extreme cases, causes the body to seize and twist in a violent, uncontrollable dance of death.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The two lethal plants have been meticulously nurtured by generations of the Fisalia family, flourishing within the gardens of Porto-Veno Castle for centuries.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So my guess was correct. The "Red Apple" in the second riddle refers to the Sea Apple, and the "Round Hat" in the last riddle points to the Jellyrose Medusa.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for the first riddle, "Siren's Song," the "crown atop the mountain" and the "waterfall that cascaded into the depths below" clearly points here—a crown-like castle that sits atop a jagged cliff, with a waterfall rushing down.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems the girls in the riddle were lured into the Porto-Veno Castle.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The strange frequencies coming from the music box probably reflect the suffering of the "ghost girls," who were poisoned and tortured in the castle.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But why? Why would the Fisalia family do this?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't believe you'd engage in such senseless cruelty or take pleasure in others' suffering.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There should be a reason behind this… Wait, there's one Fisalia tradition that might explain it. The Divine Trials.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a ritual to select a maiden of extraordinary willpower, a Fisalia who can withstand the Threnodian's whispers. I assume such extreme methods were needed for the trials.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well… I never imagined you'd solve the mystery so quickly. You never cease to amaze me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The truth behind the "ghost girl" riddle is none other than the grim secret of the Divine Trials.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The blood and tears shed in these trials throughout the years have seeped into this castle and concocted what we now call <ano=Sonoro Sphere>the Sea of Ghosts</ano>.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There, past and future intertwine, and Fisalia's ancient secrets cling to the cracks of time like grotesque scabs.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With you by my side, I would relive that trauma, and unfold the layers of forsaken time for a closer look.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And if… you find these scabs have somehow crept unto my very flesh and feel the need to cut them away, I'll place my full trust in you and leave it in your hands.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why do you trust me so much?
Can I trust you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ever since I guided you to the sanctuary… you've seen through me and all that the Fisalia family conceals.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've witnessed you cleanse the chaos of the Inverted Tower, restoring order to the heavens and seas. If you are the one to pass final judgment on me… it would be the highest honor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Absolutely. Remember my promise? Whether it's elixir or poison, I'm ready to explore it with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I, Cantarella Fisalia, value every promise I made to you and vow to see them through.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, the answers we seek lie in the depths of fierce undercurrents… Will you join me and dive into the deep sea?

Options.PlotLineKey: Sure. I'm good at swimming.
Of course. I've seen it all.
Yes. We must free those ghosts.
Yes. I have to remove the influence on me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then let's dive in together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're like a pearl from the deepest sea, but… I'd never let such a flawless gem endure even the smallest scratch.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I knew you'd say that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your wisdom, courage, and kindness… no matter how deep the waters, always shine through.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mmm, the strange frequency you carry is indeed from the Sea of Ghosts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That message with the distorted frequency is no doubt a creation of this Sonoro.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know why it reached you, but the answer is hidden within. After we uncover the truth, its influence on you will fade.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once we enter the sea, I'll be right by your side, tightly. No poisonous creature shall harm you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For you are the one I've chosen.

Options.PlotLineKey: I think I'm ready to go now.
I need some time to get ready.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Excellent. Together we dive into the Sea of Ghosts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course. It's wise to ready yourself before diving into such perilous depths.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll be waiting for you in the garden, whenever you're ready.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You follow the girl to the corner and find Cantarella dancing, her steps seemingly regulating certain frequencies.

You share your thoughts with her, and she admits that the "ghost girl" refers to the cruel Divine Trials of the Fisalia family. The blood and tears from these trials have twisted Porto-Veno Castle into the the Sea of Ghosts.

To uncover the truth and lift the "curse" binding you, you must dive into this Sea of Ghosts.

Chapters.Title: Talk to Cantarella and dive into the Sea of Ghosts

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is this still Porto-Veno Castle? Something feels… off.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes and no. The past has spilled into the present here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The overflowing frequencies have enveloped the entire castle, forming this Sonoro, the Sea of Ghosts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The voices of the ghosts rise faintly from the depths, like the soft pop of a bursting bubble. Listen closely to these whispers of the past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Piece together these fragile clues, and the answers will emerge on their own.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But do take caution. One wrong step in these murky depths, and we may be drawn into an endless abyss…

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With a bit of light, though, we can hold back the darkness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You and Cantarella enter Porto-Veno Castle, which now looks a bit different.

Cantarella explains that the twisted frequencies have overwhelmed this place, displaying a mixture of past and future.

She manages to keep the last ray of light in this dark abyss and stores it in the lamp.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though the black of the sea is overwhelming, I've managed to preserve the last ray of light.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You see, light is something that darkness can never fully devour.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As long as it flickers, it can guide us out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I, Cantarella Fisalia, hereby grant {PlayerName} unrestricted passage through Porto-Veno Castle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let us explore and weave through the past and future together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Cantarella gives you the lamp of light and grants full access to the castle.

With this lamp, you are now able to switch between the past and the future.

Chapters.Title: Use the lamp to switch between dimensions

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We are now in a fragment of the "past"… You've done well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The past that emerges from the Sea of Ghosts is not entirely real.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It only reveals what it chooses to show, which means we must uncover the hidden truth ourselves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Spirits bound in the cracks of time, wander no more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please, set them free with the light.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They've been trapped here for far too long.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The fluctuations you create can bring a brief calm to these restless frequencies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In other words, when you swiftly dodge their attacks or block with your weapon, the ghosts lurking in the cracks will be momentarily exposed before you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A few written lines appeared on the surface, seemingly the last message left before the frequencies dispersed.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (A potion that can grant any wish… Sounds familiar.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The girls must have been lured here by such impossible promises.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cantarella, since you were part of the trials yourself, why not just tell me the secret?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There, there… We're surrounded by twisted frequencies. It seems they're guiding us towards the truth of the Divine Trials, and that truth holds the key to solving the "ghost girl" mystery.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: During the trials, the ever-present abyss silently watched over us… I can feel the Sonoro Sphere has recreated that same ominous gaze.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I were to reveal everything about the past all at once, this Sonoro could grow unstable or even collapse, drowning us in its wake.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To keep us safe, we must tread carefully and avoid taking reckless actions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So let's listen carefully to what the sea is trying to tell us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You find an announcement of the previous Divine Trials.

The first trial requires the participants to select the three most toxic Sea Apples from the depths and bring them back by any means necessary.

It seems the twisted frequencies want you to experience the trials yourselves to uncover the mystery of the "ghost girl."

Chapters.Title: Use Lottie Lost to clear the contamination

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This book looks familiar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just put it back on the right shelf, like how you did before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well done. You never disappoint me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They say most questions can be answered in books, but can they really?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Stillness, darkness, and silence. "Fail," and you'll be lost in darkness. "Pass," and you'll face an even greater darkness.
Before the merciless poison, there are no winners.
So... painful...
Ergh...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sweet dreams, girls. May you rest in peace.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The answer remains submerged, yet from the ripples of the past, a familiar door rises.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe try knocking three times, as the girls once did. Knock, knock, knock...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A familiar door appears in front of you. Just knock on it three times as those girls used to do. Maybe something unexpected will happen.

Options.PlotLineKey: Knock on the door three times.
Smash the door.
Toss a Shell Credit at the door.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A strange sensation creeps into your hand as you knock. You immediately sense the shift in the surrounding frequencies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Behind the door, you catch the faint scent of seawater-soaked pages and the soft sound of jellyfish tentacles brushing through the waves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Your fist passes through the door. It's there, yet not there.
Like striking water, no matter how hard you try, the force is swallowed by the endless sea.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Nice try, but this is not a wishing well, not to mention it's reckless to make wishes to the Sea of Ghosts.
The abyss seems to have no interest in devouring you now and returns your Shell Credit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Divine Trials stand as a hallowed tradition of the Fisalia family, a ritual that demands every family member to offer their daughters to face the ordeal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet tales of these perils have driven some to seek out young girls resembling their own and use them as substitutes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These girls' parents are often offered a generous sum of money or sweet promises as compensation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Behind this intricate web stands the late head of Fisalia. To him, the Fisalia daughters who had been replaced were nothing more than "useless stones."

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The substitutes, however, he considered "rough gems" that could be polished into dazzling jewels through suffering.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For him, regardless of blood, the Maiden must be a Fisalia. To this end, no sacrifice was too great.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You find the first Sea Apple along with a note written by a worried girl, Chloe.

The Divine Trials are a hallowed Fisalia tradition, but the danger surrounding them has led some family members to seek out commoners who resemble their daughters, using them as substitutes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To avoid the watchful eyes, the girls formed secret pacts in whispers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Hum a special tune," "use the right color," "knock on the door three times every two seconds"…

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the cold, unfathomable sea, they clung to each other, seeking warmth and comfort.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The little fish huddled close, unaware of who might vanish, or what tomorrow would bring.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You find the second Sea Apple and another note from Chloe that records why and how she participated in the trials.

To avoid the watchful eyes, the girls formed secret pacts in whispers, such as "hum a special tune," "use the right color," "knock on the door three times every two seconds"…

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fisalia family is built on poison, and from a young age, every Fisalia child is introduced to it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Years of exposure gradually built up our resistance. At first, we suffered, but over time, few poisons could harm us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We are no longer merely the bearers of poison. We become the poison itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You find the third Sea Apple and another note from Chloe that reveals her change in mindset during the trials.

The Fisalia family is built on poison, and from a young age, every Fisalia child is introduced to it and learns to build up resistance.

The Fisalia bloodlines can develop poison-related abilities when exposed to poisons and pushed to the brink, but commoners rarely survive. However, a commoner girl named Annis also seemed to have awakened such an ability, though her throat was damaged by poison, leaving her forever voiceless.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are many footprints of varying sizes in the hall, all seem to belong to women, but only one is clear enough. Cantarella's footprints are among them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm… It seems safe here. We can catch our breath amid the surging undercurrents.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even in the depths of the sea, there would be a place for resting, like the eye of a storm.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps we should take a moment to explore this room. It seems like an ideal setting to gather our thoughts or simply rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The jellyfish drift gracefully, their translucent forms gliding through the water. A Jellyrose Medusa sways its delicate tentacles, its rounded body resembling an elegant hat.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It gestures behind you, and as you turn, an unexpected door stands in the center of the room.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before opening the door, have you ever imagined a scene where seawater rushes out, flooding everything before you…

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But for now, I don't think that will happen. We haven't quite reached the deep waters yet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Should we go now and see what the jellyfish are trying to say?

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's go.
I'd like to stay here a bit longer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lovely. Don't forget to knock three times.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take your time. This place feels like a gentle embrace, one that makes you reluctant to leave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Behind the door is another world where the jellyfish await your arrival.

Options.PlotLineKey: Knock on the door three times.
Smash the door.
Toss a Shell Credit at the door.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A strange sensation creeps into your hand as you knock. You immediately sense the shift in the surrounding frequencies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Your fist passes through the door. It's there, yet not there.
Like striking water, no matter how hard you try, the force is swallowed by the endless sea.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Nice try, but this is not a wishing well, not to mention it's reckless to make wishes to the Sea of Ghosts.
The abyss seems to have no interest in devouring you now and returns your Shell Credit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An aged diary rests before you, its pages filled with notes the girls once exchanged.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The cute symbols, paired with messy handwriting, pull you back to those memories of long lost past—ones too painful to dwell on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sea Apples' crimson hue is so vivid that it almost burns the eyes.

Options.PlotLineKey: These girls...
Chloe...
What exactly happened...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Every girl came from different backgrounds, each with their own unique personality yet the same determination.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even as poison gnawed at their bodies, they never lost faith in a future where freedom might bloom.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Little Chloe… I hope she's found peace somewhere, where no pain can reach her anymore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Forgive me that I can't tell you more while we remain trapped within the depths. Once we've explored the whole of this sea, the truth will rise to the surface.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Young girls are always brimming with dreams.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though their bodies are caged, their hearts take flight, winging freely through realms of imagination.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They recorded these ideas on paper, each word melting into a sweet candy to soothe their sorrows.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I still remember there was a bookshelf that kept many such pure, sweet fantasies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You find a fairytale sketchbook that seems to be made by the girls.
Though their bodies were caged, their hearts took flight, winging freely through realms of imagination.
They recorded these ideas on paper, each word melting into a sweet candy to soothe their sorrows.

Chapters.Title: (Optional) Place the sketchbook back on the bookshelf

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though time has yellowed these pages, the girls' laughter and joy still dance vividly across each line.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But it remains trapped on paper, lost to time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You find notes in the sketchbook.
Though time has yellowed the pages, the girls' laughter and joy still dance vividly across each line.
But it remains trapped on paper, lost to time.

Chapters.Title: Use the lamp to switch between dimensions

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Darkness breeds the unknown, and the unknown gives birth to fear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In a place like this, the only anchor you can rely on is the faint light by your side.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Trust its guidance. It will clear a path through the shadows and quell your fears.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It looks like a study room, but as you look up at the ceiling, the sparkling waves there make you feel this whole place is underwater.

Chapters.Title: Use the lamp to switch between dimensions

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But can the glimmers from these delicate drifters truly light up the entire sea?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In this spacious room, it's just you and Cantarella. Her gaze lingers on you, dark and endless, like a bottomless abyss.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems like fate insists we move as one, side by side.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the realm of poison, none can rival the Jellyrose Medusa.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah... a scent I know well. There's a Jellyrose Medusa, lying in wait just a little deeper.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They tend to be wary when alone, their nerves quick to tingle at the slightest move.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But worry not. I know what to do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
This is the second announcement of the Divine Trials.

In the second trial, participants should make a team of two, capture the most venomous jellyfish, and exchange their catch with their teammate. The one who survives the jellyfish's venom shall be declared the winner.

Since only you and Cantarella are in the castle, you decide to team up and find the Jellyrose Medusa.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The jellyfish drifts on the other side of the room, its movements slow and unhurried, as if the bookshelf's cover lends it courage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, I know this bookshelf well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Today, it seems ambitious. Hungry enough to devour two books at once.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One titled Past, the other, Present.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The jellyfish is right on the other side of the room, but to remove the blocking bookshelf, you need to put two books on it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are we prisoners to the insatiable appetite for knowledge, or to the ever-expanding void?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet I trust your eyes. They'll see through the tricks hidden within.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Many books seem to have been leafed through, their pages adorned with sketches and annotations in diverse handwriting styles.
Judging by the fresh ink, these touches were added not long ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An empty shell... the remnants that Past has left behind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just one more to go—the shadow cast by Present.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This one isn't picky. It's a mere accident born from the twists of time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Offer it any book, and it may reward your courage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, both Past and Present are ours.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go ahead, knock upon the door where Future lies waiting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, frightened away... our lethal yet delicate little friend.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like we need to handle these two first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A gentle glimmer lingers where the jellyfish once was, as though it is trying to tell you something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hebenon... She was such a timid girl, like a frightened rabbit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She'd peek out from behind Mandragora, her little face half-hidden.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She cried so often... I still remember the day she brought me tea laced with mercury. Her hands trembled so much, tears spilling into the cup as she tried to serve it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Such a good girl, really. So, I couldn't bring myself to refuse her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Had I not drunk it, the abyss closing in on us would have taken us both.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The tea itself... well, it was tolerable, certainly better than Sea Apple. Just a bit of burning, a touch of dizziness, and a pounding ache in the head.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whether it was her tears that softened the poison, or my body's quiet resilience, I recovered quickly enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only through suffering could the girls of the trials steal a fleeting moment of peace.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Forgive me. I shouldn't linger in memories. After all, it's the present and future that truly matter, wouldn't you say?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
A note details the remorse of a Fisalia girl named Hebenon.

As the second daughter of Fisalia's senior line, she was gentle and reluctant to harm her own blood. Yet under the watchful eye of the abyss, the girls had no choice but to drink poison for fleeting moments of peace.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... Our delicate little friend seems to have slipped above us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll find us a way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look. There it is, just a step away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, it seems everyone desires the deadliest jellyfish.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Expired obsessions rarely know when to stop.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All roads lead to our destination. Let's explore another way, shall we?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These walls can't withstand the erosion of water.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's return to the embrace of the underwater realm.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mandragora, just like her name, was a bright yet lethal flower.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, please don't misunderstand. "Lethal" is the highest praise for a Fisalia.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She clung to every teaching of the head of our family, shaping herself so meticulously that her thoughts and her very self vanished, lost to the family's cold framework.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I saw the weight of what she gave for that trial, all for a cause that was barely worthy of her sacrifice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, when she served me the scone dipped in the essence of Jellyrose, I didn't hesitate to swallow it all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She was much tougher than Hebenon, but still, behind her unwavering gaze, I caught a flicker of reluctance, a shadow of something almost tender.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for the poison, the sensation was... I felt like I was drowning in slow waves, my body twitching without control and my vision slipping into a soft blur...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And somewhere, within that haze, I saw us transformed. Birds, perhaps, dancing on a sunlit shore, carefree and joyful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But then, I woke up... There was no sunlit shore around, and I lay here, as ever, in this cold abyss.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
A note describes the determination of a Fisalia girl named Mandragora.

As the first daughter of Fisalia's senior line, she was carved by the family laws and clung to every teaching of the head of our family faithfully. However, beneath her cold resolve, a hint of hesitation still lingered.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seems like this little one is ready for a "duel," trying to take your life with its venom. But I despise unnecessary fights... Hand it to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, just place it gently here.

Options.PlotLineKey: No, I can't...
You've already endured this before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing fret about, dear. I've long since made my peace with poison.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This jellyfish, a remnant of the past, can't harm me now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have such a kind heart, {PlayerName}… Always ready to take on burdens, even while carrying your own.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But some weights belong only to those who've already weathered their storms. So, let me bear this one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: See? I'm fine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come now. We've more to uncover.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You and Cantarella return with the most venomous jellyfish. Now, it's time to follow the trial's rule and feed each other the deadly poison.

While you know nothing of poisons, Cantarella, who is well-experienced in this field, extends her hand and volunteers to take the poison herself.

You hesitate, but she smiles and calls the jellyfish to her, explaining that she has long since become immune to all poisons.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jellyfish have no voice. They simply drift in the tide, struggling to let their faint glow disperse the darkness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet here it is, a small shimmer of light, escaping the grip of the past to reach us now.

Options.PlotLineKey: Knock on the door three times.
You find this door familiar.
You're tired of knocking on it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The cacophonies from behind the door are like high waves going to burst out of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Yes, it's the third, no, maybe the fourth time it appears. Or more likely, it just keeps regenerating itself, again and again.
Perhaps the door also recognizes you as it snaps open and drags you inside.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
However, the abyss will never get tired of you. Since you have nowhere to run in the deep sea, your only choice is to face it.
The door opens wide anyway and pulls you into the waves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, it seems a subtle shift has taken place... I can smell danger...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's look closely and see what new presence lingers here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A subtle shift seems to have taken place in this familiar room.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A doll wearing a red hat has appeared on the table out of nowhere, drawing your attention.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You recall someone saying it is a symbol of fortune.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "As long as you follow the Divinity, luck will surely be on your side!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... is it really so?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are lost in thought as a door silently appears behind you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's a weight to the air behind. A mixture of whispers from the deep, dried tears, and the stale, lingering scent of blood.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Behind this is the deep water zone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you ready to face the relentless surges? The place ahead is beyond the reach of light, like the night sky devoid of stars, hungry to consume everything within.

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's go.
I'd like to stay here a little longer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It will be dark and murky there. Please, stay close to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, we do need to be well-prepared before diving into the depths... both in body and mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Behind the door is the deep water zone. Please be well-prepared beforehand.

Options.PlotLineKey: Knock on the door three times.
You find this door familiar.
You're tired of knocking on it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The cacophonies from behind the door are like high waves going to burst out of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Yes, it's the third, no, maybe the fourth time it appears. Or more likely, it just keeps regenerating itself, again and again.
Perhaps the door also recognizes you as it snaps open and drags you inside.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
However, the abyss will never get tired of you. Since you have nowhere to run in the deep sea, your only choice is to face it.
The door opens wide anyway and pulls you into the waves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Jellyrose Medusa drifts lazily nearby, its long tentacles weaving strands of both fortune and misfortune.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An old diary, with exchanged notes between young girls.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The tiny, endearing symbols and untidy scrawls pull you into the memories of that harsh, unforgiving trial again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sea Apples flourish in wild clusters. Under the shimmering water, their red hues look almost freakingly bright.

Options.PlotLineKey: About Hebenon…
And Mandragora…
Are you all right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hebenon was fragile, an easy prey to the Threnodian's whispers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She was never suited to be the Maiden. Truthfully, being chosen would never be an honor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, it was a good thing she wasn't chosen. Both she and Mandragora vanished during the trial, and no one knew their whereabouts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As if someone had quietly guided them out of sight, right under the head's nose.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, Mandragora. She was so… rigid, so willing to bend to the rules, even if they were impossible.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wish she could have seen that in this world, there's more than rigid obedience. Many things are far more precious.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Both she and Hebenon vanished during the trial, and no one knew their whereabouts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As if someone had quietly guided them out of sight, right under the head's nose.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why? I stand perfectly well right before you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tears wouldn't grant me mercy, and I never intended to blindly follow rules that were never meant to be kind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I earned my place my own way. That's why I stand here now, able to share this with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The waves came crashing, eager to snuff out every spark they found.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Poison and whispers slithered in, seeking to clip every wing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sweet dreams were shelved away, locked tight… only to wither into silent, brittle tears.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A sketchbook scribbled with the lyrics of an eerie folk song.

Chapters.Title: (Optional) Place the sketchbook back on the bookshelf

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You sense an ominous presence emanating from the bookshelf.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The next moment, it takes shape before you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Something falls from the fading chaotic frequencies.
Its form is twisted, like a lump of flesh torn from the abyss.
It's a book.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The girls' despair seeps from the book's pages, winding around your heart.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You press the book shut, your chest tight, and draw a deep breath to steady yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The messages jotted on the sketchbook are like soundless screams.
You can feel the despair of those girls from these words.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The doll's lifeless face stares at you as a prickling unease crawls up your spine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Doll Dancer A
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Final performance. Begins soon. Hat, unfit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Doll Dancer A
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Help me. Bring the Round Hat.

Options.PlotLineKey: What final performance?
You're talking about Round Hat's final performance...
Alright then.
Okie. Dokie.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The doll remains still, offering no response.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The doll hesitates for a moment, then lowers its head, remaining silent.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The doll stands still, responding to your generosity with silence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The doll stands still, responding to your teasing with silence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hm...

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you okay?
You're affected by that jellyfish, aren't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, it's… merely some old memories resurfacing. Don't worry. I'm quite well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I entered this place, I knew that certain memories would seek me out, even if I did not wish for them to.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seems I'm not as resilient as I thought…

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
A strange doll blocks your way and asks you to find a suitable round hat for her.

Meanwhile, Cantarella seems unwell but forces herself to stay collected for your sake.

Chapters.Title: Look for the round hat backstage

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here, the past and future, dreams and reality, are intricately intertwined, inseparably bound.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The chaotic frequencies here might have trapped the light.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's try once more, gently. Patience and encouragement always help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me think… the switch should be in the other room.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Light floods the room again, but your keen senses tell you something is different.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
A bizarre poster announcing the "final performance."
The two dolls on it look strangely familiar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've scoured every inch of the backstage, including every shadowed corner.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems the Round Hat isn't here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Various paintings pile up in the art room, their pigments emitting a gentle glow. They all appear to have been painted recently. But... does someone as busy as Cantarella have the leisure to paint them?

Chapters.Title: Catch up to the ballerina doll

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At long last, the final performance.
Dance! And fight!
The Maiden's crown will soon appear—
And rest upon one among you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Doll Dancer C
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Round Hat... for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Doll Dancer C
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The doll thrusts a Round Hat into your hands with no further explanation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The red velvet of the hat gleams, as if coated in a girl's shimmering tears. It's like a maraschino cherry on a frosted cake. Sweet, yet bitter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The doll thrusts a Round Hat into your hands with no further explanation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Doll Dancer A
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Round Hat. Thank you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Doll Dancer A
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Odd… but, thank you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Doll Dancer A
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The final performance. Begins now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Doll Dancer A
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go. The front. Closer… clear… reassured.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The doll's broken words seem to suggest you step closer to the stage for a clearer view.
But "reassured"… Who should feel reassured? You? Or the doll? The answer may lie ahead, once the performance begins.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The doll thanks you for bringing her the Round Hat and invites you to the stage for the final performance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Doll Dancer ???
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Show time. Need light.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The doll's face is expressionless, yet its gaze lingers unmistakably on the lamp in your hand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Doll Dancer ???
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Light. Lamp.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The frequencies... are too chaotic...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No worries. We'll try again.

Chapters.Title: Try to use the lamp again

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Strained breathing)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You must be Annis.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And also Girl A, who couldn't speak but managed to send me that message.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You want me to find her, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
