You figure out who this girl with a red round hat is. She must be Annis, the silent Ghost Girl A who sent you that message. But why hasn't she aged over these years? There's no time to dwell on this question now. After all, saving Cantarella comes first.

Annis offers to help. She closes her eyes and holds the lamp. A brilliant light appears, reigniting the lamp's glow, yet Annis vanishes in its wake.
We'd better watch ourselves! They might have tricks up their sleeves we can't even imagine!
How dare she show up in the town after everything they did!
Will the lost souls truly return home?
So... painful...
Ergh...
We'd better watch ourselves! They might have tricks up their sleeves we can't even imagine!
Ergh...
So... painful...
How dare she show up in the town after everything they did!
Will the lost souls truly return home?

Chapters.Title: Your trust has opened the heart of the deep

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Cantarella I know is unbreakable.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She will never falter even if you drown her with all these malicious whispers.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And you certainly won't shake me, either.
But can the glimmers from these delicate drifters truly light up the entire sea?
Yes, just place it gently here.
I, Cantarella Fisalia, value every promise I made to you and vow to see them through.
Besides, there are certain places that only you may be able to reach.
Come now. We've more to uncover.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now! Free him from the Threnodian's whispers.

Chapters.Title: Resolve the late head of Fisalia's obsession

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All those years of lying and scheming, and what have you gained?
A tarnished reputation? You could have walked away from this, Cantarella.
I still remember the little you. The youngest, the most neglected of all the Fisalias. You always lingered by your cauldron, and only smiled when a bird fluttered past the window.
You despise this place, don't you? But the blood in your veins... it binds you, holds you prisoner in this endless nightmare.
You loathe our rules, yet they have already seeped into your very existence.
Tell me, have you ever considered leaving? Let go of this burden that crushes you, and you'll be free as air, free to live the life you've longed for.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My dear lord, I've already gifted you the sweetest of dreams. But why do you still cling to this earthly burden?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You watched with satisfaction as I climbed over the fallen, ascended the steps to glory, and wore the thorned crown... Was that not enough for you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Late Head of Fisalia's Obsession
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Illusions are no match for poison, Cantarella. False bubbles burst, and here we are—the end of it all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, you see, illusions can also lead to true beauty.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your obsession, corrupted by whispers, has become a shadow over the castle… A deluge of delusions that shouldn't exist in this world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can feel the pain those whispers inflicted upon you. Allow me to free you from them... once more!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Years ago, Cantarella used illusions to deceive the late head of Fisalia, seizing his position and ending the cruel trials. But his remaining obsession, corrupted by the whispers, has lingered in the castle and turned the place into the Sea of Ghosts.

Together, you and Cantarella set his lingering will free.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The abyss may reside in shadows, but even the deepest darkness cannot endure the touch of light.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your trust strengthens the lamp. It now burns brighter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now is the time. Let the light shine brighter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We haven't fully banished the whispers. Watch out. The twisted obsession is returning to the shadow.

Chapters.Title: Resolve the late head of Fisalia's obsession

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My lord, I offered you the sweetest of dreams and safeguarded your legacy when you departed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have entrusted Fisalia's true faith to one most deserving, and the Threnodian's deceptions in the Inverted Tower have been laid bare.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No more whispers shall haunt us. Our children are freed from the cruel burdens of those trials.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, you too shall find release from the Threnodian's whispers.

Options.PlotLineKey: They aren't ghosts, are they?
So, this is the answer?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, nothing escapes your eyes, does it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're here, alive and well!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In that hellish duel, Cantarella shielded us with illusions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
As the lingering obsession of the late head of the Fisalias fades, the Sea of Ghosts vanishes.

With the hymns rising around you, you find yourself in the sanctuary, where the girls who are supposed to be dead stand in front of you, all safe and sound.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It all started

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: with a false hope

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An elixir to grant any wish

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: was said to be here

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We dived into darkness

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Choked down fear

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing's here but the deep... and ourselves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The elixir

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: was our blood and tears

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet the bane

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: gave us sweet dreams

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At last

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Through the shadows

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: we reached the end

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once Cantarella took charge of the family, she shielded us, keeping us safe in the castle's depths.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order's members were always prying, eager to find out the truth... I knew if we went out recklessly, we'd only invite danger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though... I really miss my home, more than I can say.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fortunately, Cantarella holds the Night of Remembrance every year. With our masks, we can slip away, even just for a while, back to our village.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's always a great comfort to see Jojo living happily and in good health.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My dear, from this night forward, you're free to be with your families.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The {Male=gentleman;Female=lady} here has solved the riddles. Together, {Male=he;Female=she} and I will craft the elixir of revival.

Options.PlotLineKey: Wait, what's going on?
I think I'm getting the picture now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since the Threnodian's lies were unraveled, the frequencies and situations on the outside have shifted.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks to you, the Order is now entangled in its own troubles, too distracted to reach into the Fisalias.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Most deeply affected by the Threnodian's whispers was the castle—where the former head was trapped, where innocent girls were lost to the trials... As the Threnodian fell, all these frequencies broke out at once.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The long-standing fear, pain, resentment, and repression—all that the whispers had suppressed burst free, becoming a new cage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The shackles of one's spirit were heavier than those from the outside. Yet, thanks to you, we shattered those shackles together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I knew then... the time had come for the girls to finally go home.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I never meant to draw you into this. I was planning to shoulder it all alone. That's why for this year's Night of Remembrance I took part myself, and as host, I chose "ghost girls" as the theme.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My plan was to break through the Sea of Ghosts, claim that I've solved the riddles and won the elixir of revival, and then use it to send the girls home when the Dance of the Dead begins at midnight.

Options.PlotLineKey: What about the letter I received?
What about the influence on me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your arrival, seemingly by chance, was perhaps destined.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The letter wasn't my doing, but I think I know who brought you to my side.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She had no intention of hurting you with the abnormal frequencies, but she had been in the twisted Sonoro for too long... long enough that she was nearly one with its frequencies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I saw that letter and sensed something unusual about you, I realized you could no longer stay out of this matter. With a special constitution, you were affected by the frequencies overflowing from the Sea of Ghosts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looking back, my arrogance blinded me... Ah, forgive me, for showing you this weak side of myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The currents here run deep, and the tangled seaweed is thick. Even I can easily become ensnared.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you… you helped me untangle these knots and weathered the torrents by my side.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks to you, the elixir was much easier to make. That's why I said, a skilled brewer is far more important than the ingredients or the process.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please, accept my heartfelt gratitude. Thank you for being here, and for staying by my side.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cantarella, you don't have to bear it all alone anymore! You've got someone you can truly count on now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, you're right. I have one last favor to ask, {PlayerName}. Could you take the elixir and see the girls home on my behalf?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fisalia doesn't enjoy a good reputation, and some villagers would resist my presence. At this point, causing any complication is the last thing I want.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You, however, as the Laureate who exposed the lies and turned the impossible into the possible, will carry a weight they can't ignore. If you're the one to handle this, the people will be convinced.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, even if the Order intends to look into this "miraculous revival" later, your status and capabilities will hold them back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But putting all that aside, it's with your effort that this elixir was possible. I can think of no one more fitting for this task.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll help until all is settled.
Don't you want to clear your name?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. Both I, and the entire Fisalia family, will aid you in any way we can.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Names are like sea foam that easily fades away. It hardly matters to me. Besides, it may not be a bad thing for people to stay wary of the Fisalias.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After all, we're a large family, with deep-rooted issues. Change takes time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Girls, gather your things. It's time to go home.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You learn from Cantarella that since the Threnodian's lies were uncovered, the frequencies and circumstances around Ragunna have shifted. The time had come for the girls to finally go home.

She admits that she never intended to involve you and had planned to handle everything herself. That's why for this year's Night of Remembrance, she took part herself and chose "ghost girls" as the theme.

She had meant to dive into the Sea of Ghosts alone, claim she had solved the riddles and obtain the elixir of revival. This would allow her to send the girls home during the midnight Dance of the Dead.

But Annis's message led you to her side to complete the plan.

Chapters.Title: Talk to Cantarella and dive into the Sea of Ghosts

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, prepared to set out?

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm ready.
I need a moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Excellent. Together we dive into the Sea of Ghosts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take your time. I don't mind lingering here a little longer with my beloved Violacas.

Chapters.Title: Return to the Castle hall and bid a final farewell to the girls

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, Cantarella, for everything you've done for us for all these years.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that we're leaving, you'll be left alone here…

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You should never have had to bear such a heavy burden.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I still remember what you told me back then, during the trials. You said you wanted to leave this place behind, go somewhere far away where no one knew you, and live freely...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chloe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But now, you're staying in this cold castle, bearing it all alone…

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As long as I am the head of Fisalia, what happened here remains buried. No more trials, no more innocent lives caught in this web.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My freedom for theirs—a fair exchange, wouldn't you say?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's time to leave, my dear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You prepare to send the girls back to their homes. Before you leave, they say their final goodbyes to Cantarella, thanking her for everything she's done for them over the years.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tonight, all the riddles are solved. Behold, the elixir of resurrection.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What a night to remember.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The Night of Remembrance has come to a perfect close, and the town settles back into its usual peace. The windmill creaks as it turns, and leaves drift lazily in the midnight breeze.
It feels like nothing ever happened, as if it was just a fleeting night's dream. But you know it was real, because Cantarella stands right beside you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *yawn* That was a really long nap.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *sniff* Mmm, the strange smell is all gone! You smell good again!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh! I had the best dream! I was dancing with all these cute Echoes! Hehe!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oops, uh... am I interrupting something?

Options.PlotLineKey: No, no, Abby. Go back to sleep.
You're just realizing it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fine... I'll just go take another nap.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe… Things have returned to normal, it seems. How delightful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's late… Would you care to come to my castle and rest for the night?

Options.PlotLineKey: I'd love that. I could use a good rest.
It will be my pleasure. Let me walk you home.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cantarella's lips curve into a gentle smile, her eyes, calm as the ocean depths, rippling with a hint of warmth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She knows you're stronger than her, but her instinct to care for you remains, as natural as the breath she takes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, the pleasure is mine, my dear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The Night of Remembrance ends smoothly, and the girls return to their homes. The lingering influence over you and Abby is lifted, and everything returns to its usual calm.

It feels like nothing ever happened, as if it was just a fleeting night's dream. But you know it was real, because Cantarella stands right beside you.

She acknowledges that you're stronger than her, but that doesn't stop her from instinctively caring for you. She invites you to rest at her now peaceful castle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With you here, this castle feels… warmer. Your presence may have dispelled the chill that used to linger.

Options.PlotLineKey: The Fisalia family...
The Divine Trials...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our family's purpose has always been clear—to resist the Threnodian's spiritual interference and hold fast to our faith in the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The cruel trials were designed to find a Maiden with an unbreakable will, someone who could withstand the Threnodian's whispers and fix her eyes on the true light.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet, in pursuit of that "noble cause," innocent lives were sacrificed without question.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't accept the so-called "necessary sacrifice," one that tramples the will of others in the name of duty. It's nothing but living off the weak.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though it's important to kindle the flames, none should forget those burned to ashes—those lives shouldn't have been squandered.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After all, we are more than just firewood.

Options.PlotLineKey: So, you chose to offer your own strength...
So, you sought a different way...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. When I took up the Sword of Divinity, I felt a <ano=Fleurdelys>presence</ano>, someone far more capable, more suitable. A new possibility emerged.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I asked the Sentinel to transfer my Second Awakening power to that girl.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel had always wielded the power of separation, but instead agreed to my proposal to combine our strengths. With that power, she confronted the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We triumphed, for the moment, but the Threnodian proved to be more difficult than we expected.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To stop the brutal Divine Trials and secure us the final victory, I chose to become the family head, drawing on every resource available to achieve our goal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I pretended to align with the Order to keep the Threnodian off guard, all while searching for a way to fully liberate the Sentinel and end the Threnodian once and for all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And then... I found you.

Options.PlotLineKey: So that's why you took me straight to the Sword of Divinity.
You must've gone through a lot.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe… I have been watching you from the moment you set foot in Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, I daresay I know you inside out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just as you chose your path, I've chosen mine. I will see it through, whatever it may cost.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, compared to what you've endured, my hardships aren't worth mentioning.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You defeated the Threnodian in the Inverted Tower, saved the people of Rinascita, and freed those young girls... and me as well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The girls are now back home, and the Threnodian's whispers have finally faded from this castle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And with the Order's concessions, the shadows over Rinascita are vanishing. Peace has come to us once more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks to you, the days of pain and sacrifice have ended. A calm life… that is the miracle you've brought.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As the head of Fisalia, I must offer you a fitting reward for all the efforts you made.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An elixir for eternal youth, perhaps? No, judging from the power of your Awakening, it seems you may already possess that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then, let it be the elixir that turns stone into gold.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I, Cantarella Fisalia, hereby offer {PlayerName} the family's entire legacy—every elixir and every hidden secret.

Options.PlotLineKey: That's too much.
Really? Everything? Does that mean...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe… the Fisalias make no unprofitable bargains. It's my privilege to give it all to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, this is "our" home now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's been a long day. You deserve a sweet, peaceful sleep.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here, a special elixir I've prepared with Albizia flowers—their gentle, lingering fragrance can waft through reality into your dream.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, close your eyes... and rest. Good night.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
It's just you and Cantarella in the castle now. She opens up to you, sharing her thoughts.

The Fisalias have always fought to resist the Threnodian's spiritual interference and hold fast to their faith in the Sentinel. The cruel trials were designed to find a Maiden with an unbreakable will, someone capable of withstanding the Threnodian's whispers.

Cantarella can't accept the so-called "necessary sacrifice" that strips others of their free will, but she understands it's the only solution. Therefore, she transferred her Second Awakening power to find a solution where no one else but her would be harmed.

She pretended to align with the Order to lull the Threnodian into complacency, all the while searching for a way to liberate the Sentinel and defeat the Threnodian once and for all.

And then, she found you. Alongside Cantarella, you shaped this peaceful, happy ending, a miracle born from both of you.
